WizardTD

Class Wave

  • java.lang.Object
    • WizardTD.Wave

  • public class Wave
extends java.lang.Object
    The Wave class represents a wave of monsters in the WizardTD. It stores information about the monsters in the wave, the wave's pre-wave pause duration and duration.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Wave(float duration, float preWavePause)
      Creates a new instance of Wave with the specified duration and pre-wave pause time.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMonster(MonsterData monsterData)
      Adds a monster's data to the wave.
      void addTotalNumberOfMonsters(int quantity)
      Adds the specified quantity to the total number of monsters in the wave.
      float getDuration()
      Returns the current duration of the wave.
      java.util.ArrayList<MonsterData> getMonsterDataList()
      Returns an Arraylist of the monster data for this wave.
      float getOriginalDuration()
      Returns the original duration of the wave (before any modifications).
      float getPreWavePause()
      Returns the time before the wave starts.
      int getTotalNumberOfMonsters()
      Returns the total quanitity of every type of monster in the wave.
      void setDuration(float num)
      Sets the current duration of the wave.
      void setPreWavePause(float num)
      Sets the pre-wave pause time.
      void updateMonsterData()
      Removes monsters with a quantity of 0 from the Wave's monster data list.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wave

        public Wave(float duration,
            float preWavePause)
        Creates a new instance of Wave with the specified duration and pre-wave pause time.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration of the wave in ticks (1/60th of a second).
        preWavePause - The pause time before the wave starts in ticks (1/60th of a second).

    • Method Detail

      • addMonster

        public void addMonster(MonsterData monsterData)
        Adds a monster's data to the wave.
        Parameters:
        monsterData - The MonsterData object representing the monster data to add to the wave.

      • getDuration

        public float getDuration()
        Returns the current duration of the wave.
        Returns:
        The current duration of the wave in ticks (1/60th of a second).

      • getOriginalDuration

        public float getOriginalDuration()
        Returns the original duration of the wave (before any modifications).
        Returns:
        The original duration of the wave in ticks (1/60th of a second).

      • getPreWavePause

        public float getPreWavePause()
        Returns the time before the wave starts.
        Returns:
        the time before the wave starts in ticks (1/60th of a second).

      • setDuration

        public void setDuration(float num)
        Sets the current duration of the wave.
        Parameters:
        num - The new duration of the wave in ticks (1/60th of a second).

      • setPreWavePause

        public void setPreWavePause(float num)
        Sets the pre-wave pause time.
        Parameters:
        num - The new pre-wave pause time in ticks (1/60th of a second).

      • getTotalNumberOfMonsters

        public int getTotalNumberOfMonsters()
        Returns the total quanitity of every type of monster in the wave.
        Returns:
        The total quanitity of every type of monster in the wave.

      • addTotalNumberOfMonsters

        public void addTotalNumberOfMonsters(int quantity)
        Adds the specified quantity to the total number of monsters in the wave.
        Parameters:
        quantity - The quantity of monsters to add.

      • getMonsterDataList

        public java.util.ArrayList<MonsterData> getMonsterDataList()
        Returns an Arraylist of the monster data for this wave.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of MonsterData objects in the wave.

      • updateMonsterData

        public void updateMonsterData()
        Removes monsters with a quantity of 0 from the Wave's monster data list.
